description: In 1971, Gil Scott-Heron warned that “the revolution will not be televised.” In Nepal, 54 years later, the revolution didn’t need to be. It was o social media, streamed, hashtagged, and VPN-routed. And when the government tried to ban the feed, Gen Z showed that revolt finds its own broadcast – with or without television, with or without permission.

title: ITR filing FY25: What is the deadline & will it be extended? Know penalty for late filing
description: ITR filing FY 2024-25: The Income Tax Department has extended the ITR filing deadline for AY 2025-26 to September 15, 2025, for non-audit taxpayers. This extension, from the usual July 31st, accommodates changes in ITR forms. Taxpayers are advised to file before the deadline to avoid penalties, including late fees up to Rs 5,000 and a 1% monthly interest on outstanding taxes.

description: Internet services faced disruptions across Africa, Asia, and the Middle East due to damaged undersea cables in the Red Sea. description: Behind the success of Edmonton Oilers stars Leon Draisaitl and Darnell Nurse. there is a friendship. A bond between their partners, Celeste Desjardins and Mikayla Nurse. The two women often show support for each other, and Celeste’s heartfelt Instagram post for Mikayla’s 30th birthday gave fans another glimpse of their strong connection beyond the ice and the NHL spotlight.

Humans' maximum lifespan: Scientists say, impossible beyond 150 years
description: Research indicates a potential human lifespan limit between 120 and 150 years, regardless of lifestyle. A study in Nature Communications reveals that the body's resilience declines with age, impacting recovery from illnesses. Analyzing blood cell counts and physical activity, scientists found a point where the body can no longer fully recover, suggesting a biological ceiling on longevity.

Avalanche strikes Siachen base camp in Ladakh; 3 soldiers killed
description: Tragedy struck the Siachen sector in Ladakh as an avalanche claimed the lives of three Indian Army personnel at a base camp. Siachen, notorious for its extreme weather and high altitude of over 18,000 feet, presents formidable challenges for military deployments.

description: J.J. McCarthy, the Minnesota Vikings' quarterback, boasts a $2 million net worth in 2025, primarily from his NFL contract and endorsements. After a setback due to injury in 2024, McCarthy is now starting for the Vikings, showcasing his talent and leadership. His financial success is expected to grow with future contracts and brand deals as his career progresses.

US firm signs $500 mn deal with Pakistan; eyes gold, antimony, rare earth and more
description: US Strategic Metals has signed a $500 million investment deal with Pakistan to develop its mineral sector, focusing on critical minerals. This agreement, along with another with Mota-Engil Group, aims to boost mineral processing and large-scale mining projects in Pakistan. The US embassy hailed the deal as a sign of strengthened US-Pakistan relations.

title: Legendary Sridevi flop put Boney Kapoor Rs 12 crore in debt; meanwhile, Pahlaj Nihalani delivered a blockbuster with zero publicity
US halts EB-1 till Oct 2025; EB-2 stays frozen: What Indian applicants must know
description: The US has halted EB-1 green card issuances until October 1, 2025, after reaching the annual cap for fiscal year 2025. This follows a similar freeze in the EB-2 category. Indian applicants face continued delays, with the EB-1 final action date stuck at February 15, 2022. No EB-1 or EB-2 approvals will be made until the new fiscal year begins. Adjustment of status applications may still be filed if priority dates remain current.

Asia Cup opening ceremony: Is it happening?
description: Asia Cup is back, with India starting its title defence against UAE. An opening ceremony is unlikely. India face Pakistan on Sunday. Shubman Gill returns, creating competition. Jasprit Bumrah leads the bowling attack. The tournament serves as preparation for the upcoming Twenty20 World Cup. All eyes are on the marquee clash between India and Pakistan.

title: Videos show FM Paudel being chased, kicked, assaulted on streets; Ex-PM Deuba hurt | Watch
Asia Cup: Backstage video of PCB chair Naqvi with Suryakumar surfaces - Watch
description: A video of Pakistan Cricket Board chairman Mohsin Naqvi warmly greeting India's T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav ahead of the Asia Cup 2025 has gone viral, adding buzz to the India-Pakistan rivalry. Despite political tensions and Naqvi's recent remarks about India, cricket took center stage as captains discussed their ambitions for the tournament, which begins today with Afghanistan facing Hong Kong.

title: Nepal GenZ protests: Ministers resign; India border on high alert - top 10 developments
description: Nepal faces a political crisis as youth-led protests against a social media ban and corruption turned violent, resulting in 19 deaths and numerous injuries. Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli resigned amidst mounting public anger, prompting a search for a new leader. Arson attacks targeted leaders' residences, and security tightened along the India-Nepal border.

All-time Indian greats: Ex-cricketer stirs debate; says 'Rohit does not quite make it'
description: Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar ignited a debate by stating that Rohit Sharma, despite his ODI achievements and leadership, doesn't quite reach the level of Indian batting legends like Gavaskar, Tendulkar, Dravid, and Kohli. Manjrekar emphasised Test cricket's significance in defining greatness, suggesting Rohit's impact in that format was not substantial enough.

Laken Snelling cheer video resurfaces as UK student faces charges
description: Laken Snelling, a former University of Kentucky cheerleader, was arrested after her newborn baby was found dead in her apartment closet. She faces charges including abuse of a corpse and tampering with evidence. The cause of death is undetermined, and Snelling is currently out on bond awaiting her next court hearing while the investigation continues.

title: Watch: PM Modi conducts aerial survey in flood-hit Himachal; to visit Punjab next
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi surveyed flood-ravaged areas in Himachal Pradesh, including Mandi and Kullu, following heavy monsoon rains. He then proceeded to Punjab for a similar assessment. Review meetings were held with officials and affected residents in both states, addressing the devastation and coordinating relief efforts. The floods have caused significant fatalities and displacement in both regions.

title: Watch: Protesters torch Nepal PM Oli’s private home; storm, vandalise president's residence
description: Protests in Nepal escalated, resulting in vandalism at the residences of President Poudel and KP Sharma Oli, alongside the torching of the Nepali Congress party office. Demonstrators are demanding accountability for fatalities during protests against the government's social media ban, which has now been reversed.

title: Ericsson job cuts in Canada: Around 100 employees impacted; staff notified
description: Swedish telecom giant Ericsson is cutting around 100 technical jobs in Canada, according to reports. The move, announced on September 8th with an effective date of October 31st, is part of a global streamlining effort. Ericsson aims to align its Canadian network management services with worldwide operations, utilizing common tools and processes.

title: Google tightens AI use: Coders face strict rules; external tools prohibited
description: Google is mandating its software engineers to exclusively use internal AI models for coding, driven by CEO Sundar Pichai's call for AI adoption to maintain competitiveness. Employees are expected to demonstrate AI proficiency, potentially influencing performance reviews and career advancement.

title: Chaos in Nepal: MEA issues advisory; helpline numbers released - key points
‘Phillies Karen’ identified, fired after taking Bader HR ball from kid
description: During a Phillies vs. Marlins game, Harrison Bader's home run ball was caught by Drew Feltwell, who gifted it to his son Lincoln. A woman demanded the ball, sparking outrage online and earning her the moniker "Phillies Karen." Despite mistaken identity claims involving Leslie-Ann Kravitz and Cheryl Richardson-Wagner, the woman's true identity remains unconfirmed.

title: Drinking green tea may help combat Alzheimer’s – but with an added ingredient
description: Research indicates that combining green tea's antioxidant, EGCG, with nicotinamide (vitamin B3) may rejuvenate aging brain cells and help clear harmful protein buildup linked to Alzheimer's. Lab studies reveal this pairing restores energy in neurons, boosting their ability to clear amyloid-beta plaques. Regular green tea consumption is associated with sharper memory and lower dementia risk.
